metadata.title: CVE-2019-5436 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap buffer overflow in the TFTP receiving code allows for DoS orarbitrary code execution in libcurl versions 7.19.4 through 7.64.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm2
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm2
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm2').
